meanings.definition: The act of producing offspring or young.
meanings.sent1: The breedings of rabbits resulted in many cute baby bunnies.
meanings.sent2: The farm had a successful season of breedings, with many new piglets and calves.
meanings.sent3: The breedings of the birds in the park made for a lively and chirpy atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The breedings of ideas in the creative minds of the team led to innovative solutions.
meanings.sent5: The breedings of the fish in the pond created a colorful and vibrant underwater world.

meanings.definition: The mating and production of offspring by animals.
meanings.sent1: The breedings of lions in the wild can be a fierce and majestic sight.
meanings.sent2: The zoo carefully monitors the breedings of endangered species to help conservation efforts.
meanings.sent3: The breedings of the monkeys at the zoo sometimes lead to playful antics among the young.
meanings.sent4: The breedings of the wolves in the forest ensure the continuation of their pack.
meanings.sent5: The breedings of the horses on the farm bring new life and energy to the stables.

meanings.definition: The raising and training of animals for specific purposes.
meanings.sent1: The breedings of the dogs for police work require dedication and skill.
meanings.sent2: The breedings of the show horses involve careful selection and grooming.
meanings.sent3: The breedings of the guide dogs provide invaluable assistance to those in need.
meanings.sent4: The breedings of the racing pigeons demand speed and endurance.
meanings.sent5: The breedings of the therapy animals bring comfort and joy to many individuals.
